summary: Since 2009, DOE's Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy (ARPA-E) has awarded about $1.3 billion to universities, companies, and national laboratories to fund energy research. In May 2017, DOE began a review of all its new financial assistance awards—including those from ARPA-E. During the review, DOE delayed new ARPA-E awards and provided limited information to those who had been selected but were still negotiating the terms of...
title: Department of Energy: New Process to Review Financial Assistance for Research Projects Created Uncertainty
